comment.author: 39191857@N05
comment._content: 1,55pm Carol - you missed the clocks in this one, have you still got sand in your ears from your holliers?  Just looking at the oil lamp as a standby, you couldn't trust the electricity in those days, the ESB were forever going on strike!

comment.author: 63429800@N06
comment._content: Great photo. I remember those old wind-up phones!

comment.author: 47290943@N03
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/paddywhack56] What did the handle actually do? Create a charge?
comment.authorname: National Library of Ireland on The Commons

comment.author: 75116182@N04
comment._content: Really nice shot!

comment.author: 39191857@N05
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/47290943@N03] The handle was a tiny generator that rang the bells in the other station phones in the loop.  If you had a call for just one station you could regulate the number of rings - 1 very long ring for everybody - 3 rings Maryborough - 4 rings Portarlington - 5 rings Timbuctoo, but they were usually closed;-)

comment.author: 63429800@N06
comment._content: As far as I can remember from a youth spent in Garda station dayrooms, the handle got you the local telephone exchange (usually the local post office) and you then got the operator to connect you to the number you wished to call.

comment.author: 92860155@N05
comment._content:
A wonderfull photo of my Grandad, he was just after moving from Moyvalley station some 3 miles down the track which was just after closing down. " A true Gentleman" 
Graham Cleary

comment.author: 47290943@N03
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/92860155@N05] So "our" Fred McDonagh was your grandad, Graham? Can you tell us anything else about him?
comment.authorname: National Library of Ireland on The Commons

comment.author: 92860155@N05
comment._content: Lived in Moyvalley station till he died in Naas hospital on the 7 July 1977, Retired in November 71 or 72, had a daughter and two sons.  His wife died on 2 Jan 1983

comment.author: 47290943@N03
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/92860155@N05] Thanks again, Graham! I've added your information up under the photo, and both this one and the one with your grandfather at Furey's in Moyvalley now have a link one to another...
comment.authorname: National Library of Ireland on The Commons
